answers.answer: This is high and she will need to make some changes in diet and exercise.  HDL should be at least in the 50's especially for a woman unless she is in menopause.  If she has not started menopause yet, the number could drop lower and the LDL numbers would most likely elevate (not sure what her LDL is).  Organic fruits and vegetables lots of them.  Little to no red meat.  Everything cooked fresh, no processed meats.  No lunch meat, no hotdogs, no ham, no charcoaling.  Strict diet should help.  Almonds and walnuts help raise HDL as does dark chocolate.  Milk chocolate helps alittle too, but it has more fat which doesn't help the LDL levels.  Skim milk only.  She may need to be on statin's for medicine or maybe Niacin (B vitamin which lowers cholesterol).  It is good that she had the test and she now knows that she has a problem to correct.  Once a person finds out, then there are medications that can help.  My husband just recently found out that he has high blood pressure and cholesterol.  He found out through his employer at a health fair.  His doctor said that it was a good thing because having the high pressure for years would wear out his heart.  New Year's resolution:  Eat healthy and exercise.

> HER TEST SCORE WAS 9.1yes, that's extraordinarily highthe first thing a doc would probably suspect is some infection (since you didn't mention any recent surgery, physical trauma, smoking, diabetes)mental stress wouldn't typically get a person that high.Let's say that there is some viral or bacterial infection which is then eliminated. You'd want to test again to determine the real baseline and then go for diet change, loss of weight etc. What was her Blood Glucose level?

question: HELLO -I NEED YOUR HELP.  MY PARTNER RECENTLY HAD A CARDIO CRP TEST DONE THROUGH HER EMPLOYER QUEST DIAGNOSTICS, BLUEPRINT FOR WELLNESS.MY CONCERN TODAY IS HER CARDIO CRP TEST.:  HER TEST SCORE WAS 9.1 MG/L  -  ISN'T THAT ABNORMALLY HIGH?!?!WHAT TEST, MEDICINES, ORGANIC FOODS /DRINKS AND DAILY ACTIVITIES CAN WE DO TO LOWER HER CRP LEVELS??I KNOW EXERCISE WILL HELP - BUT IS IT REALLY AS EASY AS 30 MIN OF EXERCISE PER DAY?.....SHE SEEMS PRETTY HEALTH -  SHE IS 42 AND OTHER THAN A LOW HDL LEVEL (46MG/DL) - AND YES, SHE IS OVER WEIGHT, ABOUT 30 LBS -  WOULD THAT PUT HER SCORE UP THERE SO HIGH?HOW ABOUT THE STRESS FACTOR?  COULD THAT CAUSE  A  SCORE OF  9.1?SHE  ACTS STRONG AND HEALTHY. SHE NEVER COMPLAINS OF PAIN.  IS THIS JUST FOR SHOW?  COULD SHE REALLY BE THIS UNHEALTHY?SORRY I HAVE SO MANY QUESTIONS. WHAT EVER INFO YOU HAVE WILL BE MUCH APPRECIATED!THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME.GRATEFULLY YOURS!SHERI333This discussion is related to/posts/show/478709.
title: WHAT STEPS CAN BE TAKEN TO LOWER CARDIO CRP
